title: The pandemic drove Clubhouse to a $4 billion valuation that never looked sustainable
description: Clubhouse said on Thursday that's it cutting half its staff two years after investors valued the nascent startup at $4 billion.

title: Snap plunges on first-quarter revenue miss
description: Snap continues to suffer in a tough digital ad market with its first-quarter sales missing analyst projections.

title: Intel reports largest quarterly loss in company history
description: The loss per share was slightly better than soft Wall Street expectations.

title: Powell duped by Russian pranksters who claimed to be Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy
description: Video clips circulated on Russian state TV showed Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell fielding questions from two well known pro-Kremlin comedians.

title: Here's why the stock market is having such a massive rally today
description: Investors looked past what appeared to be a weak first-quarter GDP report on Thursday.

title: Coinbase offers a fiery response to the SEC's threat of enforcement action
description: The crypto exchange unleashed the latest salvo against the regulator in an arguably existential battle over Coinbase's business model.

title: Hasbro, Mattel shares rise as toymakers announce multiyear licensing agreement, increased IP focus
description: Hasbro, Mattel and other toy stocks rallied on Thursday after mixed earnings reports from the two rival toymakers.

title: Meta shares are up 170% in five months despite virtually no revenue growth
description: Revenue at Facebook's parent shrank for three straight quarters before increasing slightly in the latest period, but the stock is soaring.

title: U.S. imposes sanctions on Russia and Iran for wrongful detention and hostage-taking of American citizens
description: The administration has identified at least two American citizens wrongfully detained in Russia and three in Iran along with one legal permanent U.S. resident.

title: 43-year-old used her life savings to open a bar that only plays women's sports—it brought in almost $1 million in 8 months
description: Jenny Nguyen, founder of Portland, Oregon-based The Sports Bra, says she never wanted to start her own bar or restaurant. Here's what changed her mind.

title: SEC's Gensler says 'the law is clear' for crypto exchanges and that they must comply with regulators
description: SEC Chairman Gary Gensler wrote in a post on Thursday that crypto exchanges "must come into compliance, register with us, and deal with conflicts of interest."

title: Investing in Space: Relativity CEO bets on bigger rockets, A.I. capabilities
description: Relativity Space isretiring its pioneering 3D-printed Terran 1 to focus exclusively on a new heavy-lift rocket called Terran R.

title: International bodies push Sudan's two warring military factions to extend a fragile cease-fire
description: Governments and international bodies are pushing Sudan's two warring military factions to extend a fragile cease-fire due to end Thursday night.

title: Amazon set to report first-quarter earnings after the bell
description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy has been aggressively slashing costs through layoffs, a corporate hiring freeze and by ending some experimental projects.

title: U.S. GDP rose at a 1.1% pace in the first quarter as signs build that the economy is slowing
description: Gross domestic product was expected to increase at an annualized pace of 2% in the first quarter, according to Dow Jones.

title: OPEC says IEA should be 'very careful' with repeated calls to stop investing in oil
description: Oil producer group OPEC on Thursday lashed out at the IEA, saying the energy agency should be "very careful" about undermining industry investments.

title: Comcast beats estimates despite slowing broadband growth, higher Peacock losses
description: Comcast topped analyst expectations, despite a tough comparison to last year, when NBC aired both the Super Bowl and Beijing Olympics during the first quarter.

title: Recession risk and inflation fears creating 'a huge amount of confusion' for investors, strategist says
description: Bob Parker, senior advisor at International Capital Markets Association, said investor confusion appeared to be emerging as a big theme in financial markets.

title: The EU outlined its plan to equalize drug access and lower prices. Pharma firms are not happy
description: A proposal for the biggest shake-up in pharma rules for decades has finally arrived, but companies say they could take their innovative medicines elsewhere.

title: Barclays posts 27% rise in net profit for the first quarter, beats expectations
description: London-based bank Barclays reported first quarter results ahead of consensus on Thursday, with income boosted by higher rates and credit cards.

title: Oil major BP braces itself for shareholder revolt after scaling back its climate targets
description: BP is bracing itself for a shareholder revolt on Thursday after the oil major rolled back its emission reduction targets in the wake of record profits.

title: Singapore hikes property tax in latest round of cooling measures
description: Both local and foreign buyers of residential properties will now have to pay higher additional buyers' stamp duties, which will take effect from today.

title: Deutsche Bank logs 11th straight quarterly profit, reveals job cuts
description: Deutsche Bank on Thursday reported a net profit of 1.158 billion euros ($1.28 billion) for the first quarter.

title: Fintech giants Klarna and Block slam 'outdated' UK buy now, pay later regulation proposals
description: Executives at two of the world's biggest buy now, pay later firms say that the U.K. regulation plans will result in disproportionate friction for consumers.

title: Kremlin critics and Putin's political enemies face an 'extremely dangerous' situation in Russia right now
description: Political opposition within Russia has been fraught with risks for years but now it is becoming increasingly impossible, particularly against a backdrop of war.

title: A U.S. tech downturn offers India 'a bigger opportunity,' says Infosys founder
description: Narayana Murthy, founder of India's IT giant Infosys, sees a downturn in the U.S. or other developed nations as an opportunity for India.

title: Tucker Carlson breaks his silence without addressing why Fox News fired him
description: Tucker Carlson broke his silence in a video on Twitter two days after he was fired from his primetime post on Fox News.

title: Samsung's profit plunged 95% amid weak memory chip demand
description: Samsung's profit plunged in the first quarter of 2023 as prices for memory chips continued to fall and demand remained weak.
